comment: Dr. Greensmith is a fantastic professor! He is a quick grader, an encouraging professor, and organizes the class' content in a well that is very clear and easy to navigate.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Greensmith is a wonderful professor. He really cares for his students and is available after class if needed. The feedback he gives has helped me feel more confident in my writing. He really has been one of my favorite professors at KSU. I would recommend taking him for any class you can, he is amazing!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Very knowledgeable person and you will learn a TON. Lots of reading from the textbook. Not as hard of a grader as I expected, if you're a good writer, you'll be fine. Literally, just act like you know what you're talking about and use correct APA. Discussion posts are tough, more like a paper (references, etc). Ends semester with a 19 pg paper.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: pretty straightfoward class. everything in this class was pass/fail besides the two papers, presentation, and attendance. there is a looot of reading for this class, but he is more lenient in this class than others. greensmith gives you what you need to pass, so i think he expects a lot out of you
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: He has good knowledge about the topics, and he will want you to learn the material on a very high level. However, there are so many papers, quizzes, and readings. A LOT OF READING. He is a very harsh grader and will take a good chunk of points off of your work if you do not do it on a very high professional level.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Professor Greensmith was a really tough professor, this is a class where you really need to try for your grade. The work is kinda difficult but doable! I made it through the class with an A but would not take him again..
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Greensmith is a nice guy but oh my god does he grade tough. I have never had a professor grade as tough as him. Discussion posts are actually pretty tough and you have to read A LOT! He's nice but I would not take him again. Take this professor at your own risk!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I had Cameron for three of my classes while in the Human Services program. The first two classes were extremely tough and I had to do a ton of work. Yet, taking his capstone class this semester has given me a new outlook. He made us think about our life and the directions we truly want to go in. I have a new respect for him and recommend to anyone
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Greensmith is an amazing professor and really cares about his students. He makes you work for your grade so don't get lazy because his assignment requires you to write a paper to a legislator. He is a stickler when it comes to grading assignments because he wants to know if you understand the material. He is reasonable and will work with you!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Cameron is the best prof in the HS department. We have it EASY most of the time, and are lazy because of it. Cameron challenges students, while also providing specific and clear feedback. He values honesty and commitment from his students, and if you are clearly not willing to work hard, he notices and grades accordingly to honest effort and work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a tough grader, but this is only because he wants his students to really apply themselves. Talk to him, set up meetings, and do the work he asks of you. There is a big work load, but it will help you become a better HS professional in the end. This class is for your major and he is preparing you for that; very reasonable man and understanding
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: He grades hard. Basically need to become an expert at writing & knowing APA format, if you dont he tells you and not exactly nicely either. Lots of writing, an annoying amount. I dont think hes mean, just a little too harsh for me personally, but I dont think he has bad intentions
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I took 5 classes this semester, two of them being with Professor Greensmith. He seems like a nice enough guy, but is definitely the kind of teacher that fails you for fun. I can't stand teachers who find joy in failing their students instead of teaching them and helping them graduate!! Both of his classes were the hardest I have ever had.

Every rubric he created had spelling & grammar errors, yet he still gave me a failing grade on every discussion post I had this semester. He grades SO harshly no matter how much effort you put into an assignment. There are difficult and lengthy discussion posts due weekly, both classes had 10+ page essays due, final exam had a 5 page essay, etc.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Having Greensmith twice has simply made it the worst semester ever. Two twelve page papers, 500 + intense discussions each week, only using sources he gives you, etc. Don't take him unless you have to and make sure you're not taking five classes and work full-time because you will struggle to say the least.
rating_tags: So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Greensmith cares. Just point blank, he cares about his students and the material. It may be difficult, but he is pushing you to learn. I turned in an assignment that wasn't great, but he sent it back, helped me and allowed me to resubmit. He'll work with you. Just don't be lazy (:
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I went into this class thinking it would be the worst experience because of the ratings, but I was completely mistaken. Yes, he might give a bit of assignments but it's a reasonable amount and he truly cares that his students understand what he is teaching. Regardless of what others say, this is the best class I've taken all semester. HAVE NO FEAR!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Cameron Greensmith is the worse professor in the entire department of Human Services. He is a very hard grader, he barely gives feedback if you don't get a perfect score and also, he is opinionated and if your opinion doesn't match his you'll fail. Honestly, if I can never see his face or him teach another class ever again, it'll be a blessing.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: If you value your education and need a professor dedicated to the same thing, Greensmith is your guy. You will work for your A, AND learn genuinely important material. Greensmith challenges you to look past your beliefs and learn what is truly important. An open mind and dedication is essential to pass his class. He is a teacher that cares!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: I absolutely love Greensmith! I was dreading taking this class but he really helped me to understand and appreciate the readings. Readings are sometimes difficult to digest but he helps you understand it and retain the information. I would definitely take him again. Hes understanding and makes the dry material actually interesting and relevant.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Greensmith is absolutely one of the best professors I have ever had! I really dont understand how his reputation as a bad professor came about. As long as you speak out in class, read the required readings, do the questions, and speak from facts and not feelings youre going to do fine in the class. He really works to help you pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Greensmith truly cares about his students. Although the assignments are harder, they are college level and Greensmith will help you through them. As much work as you put in he will also put in.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I had Dr. Greensmith for two classes, Poverty & Culture and Social Welfare & Policy. I truly enjoyed both classes. He makes his lectures very interactive and enjoyable. Theres a lot of reading but his assignments are fair and he will work with you to get the grade you deserve. I got an A in both classes! I would definitely take him again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Greensmith as I have said is an amazing professor. You need to work hard for an A. Book review including in class is 10-12 pages. Start early. Readings every week and are long, participation is very important. Always ask for feedback. He is a tough grader, but will push you to do your best work. Will definitely consider taking him again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Greensmith is one of the best teachers I've had at KSU. He is a very tough grader, but may offer times for you to fix an assignment if you just meet with him. The reading amount in this class is A LOT. If you do not do the readings, you will not be prepared for class, and lose on participation. Participation is a good chunk- 15%.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I absolutely love Cameron. He truly is a great professor. Offers so much encouragement and help whenever you need it. Is a tough grader , but IT HELPS. Really down to earth guy and very blunt, which I loved! It is a very reading heavy course, but no tests, lots of group discussion about any and everything ! I learned so much in this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: His papers are difficult & specific to what he wants to see. Always make sure you come to class & participate daily. Sometimes the conversations in class felt very closed off & opinion based, so be weary of that. However, he really does care about students & has good intentions. Take advantage of office hours & get to know him outside of class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took Greensmith for two classes this semester and I really learned a lot. Most of my classmates were hard on him because he actually made us work for our grades, but I appreciated it. His class is tough, but extremely beneficial if you try. He's super cool and cares for his students and is always willing to help if your stuck on something.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I had Cameron twice and let me tell you he is not easy. So much of his course is centered on his own opinions. He loaded on the work and continually interrupts and shut down people if they didn't saying what he wanted. Tough grader. Had to cater writing around him. Long final paper. Nice guy but would not take him again though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor Greensmith has been one of the hardest/greatest professors I've ever taken. His class is tough but you really learn so much from it. I feel like I've taken more away in his class in one semester than all of my major core classes combined. He's a tough grader but in the end you end up becoming a much stronger writer.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: A lot of reading. Make sure you put effort into participating, speak up and speak out. Be prepared to be in groups mostly every class period. (for all the introverts)Did I mention class participation matters. No tests or final given. The main assignments are: creating a letter, a book review and journal entries as well as participation.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He provides articles outside of textbook readings sometimes, that pertain to course material so be prepared to read. He enjoys open conversation, so be prepared to speak in class your participation grade depends on it!! Other then that great teacher and is willing to learn just as you are!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters
